gaia::content::SmsInfos Class Reference

The class to provide base facility to access SMS related content, which is stored in a SQLite database and in the file system. More...

#include <SmsInfos.h>

List of all members.

SmsInfosProxy * mpSmsInfosProxy

Detailed Description

The class to provide base facility to access SMS related content, which is stored in a SQLite database and in the file system.

The following example demonstrates how to use this SmsInfos class.

 addSmsInfos() {
     // Add a SmsInfos
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     SmsInfos* smsInfos = new SmsInfos(*context);
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();

     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::TYPE(), type);
     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::THREAD_ID(), threadId);
     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::ADDRESS(), address);
     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::BODY(), body);
     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::PERSON(), person);
     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::READ(), true);

     smsInfos->add(SmsInfos::SMS_URI(), *cv);

     delete context;
     delete smsInfos;
     delete cv;
 }

 showEditAndDeleteSmsInfos() {
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     SmsInfos* smsInfos = new SmsInfos(*context);
     StringArray selection(4);
     selection.replaceAt(SmsInfos::ID(), 0);
     selection.replaceAt(SmsInfos::DATE(), 1);
     selection.replaceAt(SmsInfos::ADDRESS(), 2);
     selection.replaceAt(SmsInfos::BODY(), 3);

     // Show SmsInfoss
     Cursor* cr = smsInfos->getN(SmsInfos::SMS_URI(), &selection, NULL, NULL,
                                 &SmsInfos::SMS_ORDER());

     if (cr != NULL && cr->getCount() > 0) {
         cr->moveToFirst();
         do {
             int64_t id = cr->getLong(0);
             int64_t date = cr->getLong(1);
             String address = cr->getString(2);
             String body = cr->getString(3);

             // ...
         } while (cr->moveToNext());
     }
     // Close the cursor
     cr->close();

     // Edit a SmsInfos
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();
     cv->addValue(SmsInfos::SUBJECT(), newSubject);

     Uri uri1 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(SmsInfos::SMS_URI(), updateId);
     smsInfos->set(uri1, *cv, NULL, NULL);

     // Delete a SmsInfos
     Uri uri2 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(SmsInfos::SMS_URI(), deleteId);
     smsInfos->remove(uri2, NULL, NULL);

     delete context;
     delete smsInfos;
     delete cv;
 }

See the sample given above. There are four operations about SmsInfos: add, edit, show and remove.

Definition at line 105 of file SmsInfos.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::SmsInfos::SmsTypes

Contains types for all available sms.

Enumerator:
MESSAGE_BOX_ALL 

For all messages.

MESSAGE_BOX_INBOX 

For inbox messages.

MESSAGE_BOX_SENT 

For sent messages.

MESSAGE_BOX_DRAFTS 

For draft messages.

MESSAGE_BOX_OUTBOX 

For outbox messages.

MESSAGE_BOX_FAILED 

For failed outgoing messages.

MESSAGE_BOX_QUEUED 

For messages to send later.

static base::String gaia::content::SmsInfos::DATA_SMS_RECEIVED_ACTION ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: A new data based SMS message has been received by the device.

The demand will have the following extra values:

  • pdus - An Object[] of byte[]s containing the PDUs that make up the message.

The extra values can be extracted using getMessagesFromDemand(Demand).

If a BroadcastReceiver encounters an error while processing this demand it should set the result code appropriately.

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::SmsInfos::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

int64_t gaia::content::SmsInfos::getOrCreateThreadId ( const base::StringArray &  recipients,
int32_t  phoneType 
)

Given the recipients list and subject of an unsaved message, return its thread ID.

If the message starts a new thread, allocate a new thread ID. Otherwise, use the appropriate existing thread ID.

Find the thread ID of the same set of recipients (in any order, without any additions). If one is found, return it. Otherwise, return a unique thread ID.

Parameters:
recipientsthe string list of recipients.
phoneTypethe phone type of the message.
Returns:
the thread ID.
int64_t gaia::content::SmsInfos::getOrCreateThreadId ( const base::String &  recipient)

This is a single-recipient version of getOrCreateThreadId.

It's convenient for use with SMS messages.

Parameters:
recipientthe string of recipient.
Returns:
the thread ID.

int32_t gaia::content::SmsInfos::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.

static base::String gaia::content::SmsInfos::SMS_CB_RECEIVED_ACTION ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: A new Cell Broadcast message has been received by the device.

The demand will have the following extra values:

  • pdus - An Object[] of byte[]s containing the PDUs that make up the message.

The extra values can be extracted using getMessagesFromDemand(Demand).

If a BroadcastReceiver encounters an error while processing this demand it should set the result code appropriately.

static base::String gaia::content::SmsInfos::SMS_REJECTED_ACTION ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: An incoming SMS has been rejected by the telephony framework.

This demand is sent in lieu of any of the RECEIVED_ACTION demands. The demand will have the following extra value:

  • result - An int result code, eg, RESULT_SMS_OUT_OF_MEMORY, indicating the error returned to the network.

static base::String gaia::content::SmsInfos::SMS_SERVICE_CATEGORY_PROGRAM_DATA_RECEIVED_ACTION ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: A new CDMA SMS has been received containing Service Category Program Data (updates the list of enabled broadcast channels).

The intent will have the following extra values:

  • operations - An array of CdmaSmsCbProgramData objects containing the service category operations (add/delete/clear) to perform.

The extra values can be extracted using getMessagesFromIntent(Intent).

If a BroadcastReceiver encounters an error while processing this intent it should set the result code appropriately.

static base::String gaia::content::SmsInfos::TYPE ( ) [static]

The type of the message.

The choice in SmsTypes is listed as follows: MESSAGE_BOX_ALL = 0 MESSAGE_BOX_INBOX = 1 MESSAGE_BOX_SENT = 2 MESSAGE_BOX_DRAFTS = 3 MESSAGE_BOX_OUTBOX = 4 MESSAGE_BOX_FAILED = 5 MESSAGE_BOX_QUEUED = 6

Type: INTEGER

static base::String gaia::content::SmsInfos::WAP_PUSH_RECEIVED_ACTION ( ) [static]

Broadcast Action: A new WAP PUSH message has been received by the device.

The demand will have the following extra values:

  • transactionId (Integer) - The WAP transaction ID
  • pduType (Integer) - The WAP PDU type
  • header (byte[]) - The header of the message
  • data (byte[]) - The data payload of the message
  • contentTypeParameters (HashMap<String,String>)
    • Any parameters associated with the content type (decoded from the WSP Content-Type header)

If a BroadcastReceiver encounters an error while processing this demand it should set the result code appropriately.

The contentTypeParameters extra value is map of content parameters keyed by their names.

If any unassigned well-known parameters are encountered, the key of the map will be 'unassigned/0x...', where '...' is the hex value of the unassigned parameter. If a parameter has No-Value the value in the map will be null.
